intro: Neobaumannia, commonly known as the desert broom, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. These plants are native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Neobaumannia species are shrubs or small trees that typically have woody stems and compound leaves. They produce small, yellow to white flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. The genus is characterized by its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
